lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bwn DnuK sihq h√çY inj bs CUtiq n AwvY Pun jqn sY hwQ jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Baan Dhanoukh Sahit Hvai Nij Basa , Chhootati N Aavai Dhoun Jatan Sai Haad Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an arrow is in full control (of the warrior) as long as it remains in the bow, but once released cannot come back howsoever one may try.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bwG bMDswlw ibKY bwDRXo rhY pun KulY qo n AwvY bs bsih n swQ jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Baagh Bandhasaalaa Bikhai Baadhyo Rahai Pouna , Khulai To N Aavai Bas Basahi N Saad Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a lion remains in a cage, but when released cannot be brought under control. Once out of control, it cannot be tamed.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy dIp idpq n jwnIAY Bvn ibKY dwvwnl Bey n durwey durY nwQ jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Deep Dipat N Jaaneeai Bhavan Bikhai , Daavaanal Bhaay N Duraaay Durai Naad Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the heat of a lit lamp is not felt by anybody in the house, but if it becomes the fire of the jungle (spreads in the house) then it becomes uncontrollable.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy muK mD bwxI bsq n koaU lKY bolIAY ibcwr gurmiq gun gwQ jI ]630]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Moukh Madh Baanee Basat N Kooo Lakhai , Boleeai Bichaar Gurmati Goun Gaad Jee ?630?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, no one can know the words on one's tongue. Like an arrow released from the bow, words spoken cannot be taken back. Therefore one should always think and reflect on what one is about to say and all conversation should be in accordance with the w
